TEXT: The applicant , Mr PERSON , is a NORP national , who was born in DATE and lives in GPE .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .
The applicant was the owner of a company , Can Ticaret . In DATE the applicant bought carpets from a company called ORG ve FAC ( ORG : hereinafter “ ORG ” . ) .

On DATE , and in furtherance of this transaction , the applicant received for signature CARDINAL promissory notes ( bono ) which were to be paid DATE and DATE . According to the applicant , the promissory notes had been prepared for the applicant 's signature by PERSON who allegedly worked for ORG at the material time . Having stamped and signed them , the applicant sent the promissory notes to ORG . The promissory notes met the legal requirements of LAW .

It subsequently transpired that the applicant 's cousin , GPE , was named as the debtor on the promissory notes . However , the applicant maintains that he only stamped and signed the promissory notes when he received them and did not add any names to them . In the applicant 's opinion , his cousin 's name must have been added by PERSON
On an unknown date ORG applied to ORG ( icra müdürlüğü ) to have the promissory notes enforced against the applicant 's cousin , GPE

On DATE GPE applied to the public prosecutor 's office in the PERSON district requesting that criminal proceedings be brought against the applicant . The applicant was subsequently charged with forgery under LAW .
On DATE , the PERSON public prosecutor issued a decision of lack of territorial jurisdiction ( yetkisizlik kararı ) and sent the case file to the public prosecutor 's office in LOC .
On DATE the NORP public prosecutor filed a bill of indictment with ORG charging the applicant with forgery under LAW .

During the criminal proceedings against the applicant ORG issued a summons requiring PERSON to give evidence . In the applicant 's submission , ORG had fraudulently added GPE 's signature to the promissory notes .
On DATE Ş.C. withdrew his accusation against the applicant . However , the prosecution proceeded with the charges against the applicant .
On DATE ORG requested ORG to inform it whether PERSON had been employed by the firm at the time of the offence .
On DATE ORG informed the court that no one of that name had ever worked for the company .

On DATE the court abandoned the proposal to hear PERSON referring to the response given by ORG and observing that PERSON could not be found . Furthermore , the court did not find it necessary to request ORG to carry out an analysis as to whether the applicant 's handwriting matched the manner in which the name of GPE was written on the promissory notes .
On DATE ORG convicted the applicant of forgery under LAW and sentenced him to DATE and DATE imprisonment .

On DATE the applicant appealed against ORG judgment on the ground that PERSON was not heard before the court and that a comparative analysis of his handwriting and the handwriting on the promissory notes had not been carried out .
On DATE ORG rejected the applicant 's appeal and upheld the judgment of ORG .
On DATE the applicant lodged a petition with ORG requesting that his case be re - opened .
On DATE this request was dismissed .
On DATE the applicant lodged an appeal with ORG against ORG decision of DATE .
On DATE this very last appeal of the applicant was dismissed by ORG .
On DATE the applicant started serving his prison sentence .
On DATE he was released from prison on probation .
CARDINAL . LAW provides :
“ A civil servant who prepares a partially or completely forged document or distorts an authentic document shall be imprisoned for DATE if damage arises out of this forgery ... ”
CARDINAL . LAW CARDINAL of LAW provides :
“ A person who is not a civil servant and who forges an official document by way of the methods specified in LAW shall be imprisoned for DATE ... ”
